# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [1.0.0] - 2025-09-18

### Added
- 🚀 Initial release of DynamicBatcher
- ⚡ Intelligent dynamic batching for transformer models
- 🧠 Adaptive batch sizing based on workload patterns
- 📊 Real-time performance monitoring and statistics
- 💾 Smart caching for repeated inputs
- 🔧 Seamless HuggingFace integration
- 📝 Comprehensive documentation and examples
- 🧪 Full test suite with unit tests
- 🎯 Interactive demo scripts
- 📖 Jupyter notebook tutorial
- 🌐 Bilingual README (English/Persian)
- 🔄 GitHub Actions for CI/CD
- 📦 PyPI package ready

### Features
- Length-based sequence grouping to minimize padding
- Thread-safe operations for concurrent access
- Automatic device detection and management
- Configurable timeouts and batch sizes
- Performance benchmarking utilities
- Memory-efficient processing
- Error handling and validation

### Examples
- Sentiment analysis demo
- Advanced benchmarking script
- CSV file processing example
- API integration example
- Performance monitoring example

### Technical Details
- Python 3.8+ support
- PyTorch 1.9+ compatibility
- HuggingFace Transformers integration
- Type hints throughout codebase
- Comprehensive docstrings
- MIT license

## [Planned] - Future Releases

### 1.1.0
- [ ] Support for more model types (T5, BART, etc.)
- [ ] Async batching for web applications
- [ ] Advanced caching strategies
- [ ] Performance profiling tools

### 1.2.0
- [ ] Multi-GPU support
- [ ] Custom tokenizer support
- [ ] Batch optimization algorithms
- [ ] Web dashboard for monitoring

---

For a complete list of changes, see the [commit history](https://github.com/shayanthn/dynamic-batcher-transformers/commits/main).
